page.title: 11RECREATION...
page.content: Asewing class is held every Tuesday in St Lukes Church vestry in N Cowton. Members pay 20p for tea & biscuits which members bring on a rota basis. Northallerton Education Committee holds an evening sewing class weekly in E Cowton school during the winter. Over the years many village ladies have attended embroidery, sewing, soft furnishings and upholstery classes. Everyone helps each other in what they are most profficient at. The majority enjoy knitting and crocheting. Some make soft toys and two Brambley Lodge mice were on the North Yorkshire W.I. stand at the Great Yorkshire Show at Harrogate in July 1985. Quite a few ladies have been to flower arranging classes and won prizes at Scorton show. All of the displays at South Cowton Flower Festival were done by N & S Cowton ladies.
